description: Returns information about an audience generation job.

parameters.name: audienceGenerationJobArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the audience generation job that you are interested in.

nested_items.name: createTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the audience generation job was created.

nested_items.name: updateTime
nested_items.description: The most recent time at which the audience generation job was updated.

nested_items.name: audienceGenerationJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the audience generation job.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the audience generation job.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the audience generation job.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the audience generation job.

nested_items.name: statusDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the status of the audience generation job.

nested_items.name: statusCode
nested_items.description: The status code that was returned. The status code is intended for programmatic error handling. Clean Rooms ML will not change the status code for existing error conditions.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The error message that was returned. The message is intended for human consumption and can change at any time. Use the statusCode for programmatic error handling.

nested_items.name: configuredAudienceModelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configured audience model used for this audience generation job.

nested_items.name: seedAudience
nested_items.description: The seed audience that was used for this audience generation job. This field will be null if the account calling the API is the account that started this audience generation job.

nested_items.name: dataSource
nested_items.description: Defines the Amazon S3 bucket where the seed audience for the generating audience is stored. A valid data source is a JSON line file in the following format:

nested_items.name: s3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location URI.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that can read the Amazon S3 bucket where the seed audience is stored.

nested_items.name: sqlParameters
nested_items.description: The protected SQL query parameters.

nested_items.name: queryString
nested_items.description: The query string to be submitted.

nested_items.name: analysisTemplateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the analysis template within a collaboration.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: The protected query SQL parameters.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: sqlComputeConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides configuration information for the instances that will perform the compute work.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The instance type of the compute workers that are used.

nested_items.name: number
nested_items.description: The number of compute workers that are used.

nested_items.name: includeSeedInOutput
nested_items.description: Configure whether the seed users are included in the output audience. By default, Clean Rooms ML removes seed users from the output audience. If you specify TRUE, the seed users will appear first in the output. Clean Rooms ML does not explicitly reveal whether a user was in the seed, but the recipient of the audience will know that the first minimumSeedSize count of users are from the seed.

nested_items.name: collaborationId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the collaboration that this audience generation job is associated with.

nested_items.name: relevanceMetrics
nested_items.description: The relevance scores of the generated audience.

nested_items.name: audienceSize
nested_items.description: The size of the generated audience. Must match one of the sizes in the configured audience model.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Whether the audience size is defined in absolute terms or as a percentage. You can use the ABSOLUTE  AudienceSize to configure out audience sizes using the count of identifiers in the output. You can use the Percentage  AudienceSize to configure sizes in the range 1-100 percent.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: Specify an audience size value.

nested_items.name: score
nested_items.description: The relevance score of the generated audience.

nested_items.name: recallMetric
nested_items.description: The recall score of the generated audience. Recall is the percentage of the most similar users (by default, the most similar 20%) from a sample of the training data that are included in the seed audience by the audience generation job. Values range from 0-1, larger values indicate a better audience. A recall value approximately equal to the maximum bin size indicates that the audience model is equivalent to random selection.

nested_items.name: startedBy
nested_items.description: The AWS account that started this audience generation job.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: protectedQueryIdentifier
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the protected query for this audience generation job.
